intro: Agoseris elata, commonly known as the tall larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in meadows and open woodlands. Agoseris elata is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms.
